dmca.title: copyright infringement
dmca.body:
From: Chris Carmody [mailto:cbc@mbbp.com] 
Sent: Wednesday, August 03, 2005 3:13 PM
To: copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: copyright infringement



Please see the attached letter concerning copyright infringement being
engaged in on a website that you host.

 

Christopher Carmody, Paralegal

Morse, Barnes-Brown & Pendleton, P.C.
Reservoir Place

 1601 Trapelo Road
Waltham, MA 02451
PH: (781) 622-5930  // Fax: (781) 622-5933

E-Mail: cbc@mbbp.com
Website:  <http://www.mbbp.com/> www.mbbp.com
Business | Securities | M&A | Technology + IP | Tax | Employment +
Immigration 

To ensure compliance with U.S. Treasury Regulations governing tax practice,
we inform you that any U.S. tax advice contained in this communication
(including any attachments) 
is not intended or written to be used, and cannot be used, for the purpose
of 
(i) avoiding penalties under the Internal Revenue Code or 
(ii) promoting, marketing or recommending to another party any transaction
or matter addressed herein.

This message (including any attachments) may be a confidential and
privileged communication to the intended addressee.
If you are not the intended addressee, you have received this message in
error.
In that case, please permanently delete this message and call us at
781-622-5930 so that we can avoid this inconvenience in the future.
Thank you.


---Attached Letter---

Morse, Barnes-Brown & Pendleton, P.C.
Reservoir Place

1601 Trapelo Road
Waltham, MA 02451
PH: (781) 622-5930  // Fax: (781) 622-5933

E-Mail: cbc@mbbp.com
Website:  <http://www.mbbp.com/> www.mbbp.com

August 3, 2005

VIA CERTIFIED AND ELECTRONIC MAIL:  copyright@theplanet.com

Mr. George Poletes, Legal Counsel
ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc.
1333 North Stemmons Freeway, Suite 110
Dallas, TX 75207

RE: Copyright Infringement

Dear Mr. Poletes:

This law firm represents Kaspersky Lab, Inc. ("Kaspersky").  Kaspersky is the holder of intellectual property rights, including without limitation copyrights, in and to software called "Kaspersky(R) Anti-Virus PersonalPro" (reffered to herein as "PersonalPro").

It has come to our attention that the website www.p-tv2.net, which is hosted by www.theplanet.com, is illegally distributing copies of PersonalPro.  This unauthorized distribution constitutes an infringement of Kaspersky's exclusive intellectual property righs.

The infringing work consists of a full version Personal Pro and can be found at hte URL http://www.p-tv2.net/ptv2/index.html.  I have attached the "WHOIS" information for this site for your convenience.

We hereby demand that you immediately remove and disable access to the infringing work.  Your continued facilitation of the distribution of the infringing work could constitute copyright
infringement under U.S. and the international laws and treaties.

The undersigned hereby declares:  that he has a good faith belief that the use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by Kaspersky, its agents or the law; that based on information and belief the information contained herein is accurate; and that under penalty of perjury he is authorized to act on behalf of Kaspersky.

Continued violation of Kaspersky's intellectual property rights shall cause injury to Kaspersky in Massachusetts, USA, the location of Kaspersky's home office.

Nothing in this letter shall be construed as a waiver or relingquishment of any rights or remedy possessed by Kaspersky or any other affected party.

Very truly yours,

Michael J. Cavarette


cc:   Kaspersky Lab, Inc.
